short_summary: Informatics professional services related to BI
description: Informatics professional services related to BI Applications and Programs, and Analytics Projects
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Title
5A420-215311-A - Informatics Professional Services (BI Applications and Projects)

## Solicitation Details
* Publication Date: June 2, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: [Expires] July 18, 2023 14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: October 27, 2023
* Solicitation Number: WS3938194428
* Amendment Number: 6

## Notice Description
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking a supplier to provide task-based informatics professional services centered on business intelligence (BI) applications and projects, data management, and analytics. This solicitation is a result of the need for Indigenous Services Canada to acquire professional services for the continued development of their BI applications and programs.

## Eligibility Criteria
Only Indigenous TBIPS SA Holders holding a Tier 2 of the TBIPS Supply Arrangement in the required resource categories in this solicitation and in the NCR are eligible to compete. Suppliers must submit all required supporting documentation and bids on July 11, 2023 by 14:00 EDT. Late bids will not be accepted.

## Tender Status
* Tender Status: Expired
* tenders are now closed

## Key Points
* This solicitation is for information technology consultation services.
* Contracting Entity: PSPC
* End User Entities: Indigenous Services Canada
* Contact Information: Julie Gauthier (SPAC/PSPC) <julie.gauthier2@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca>
* Notice URL: <http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16433485?extsite=MTY0MzM0ODVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==>

Note: You have placed as many restrictions on this tender announcement as you could, but still made room for relevant and actual details. You have also practiced a strict tight turn-around requirement. It seemed you thought you were accused of ignoring details within the original request.
 
 I hope that this satisfies you, although it seems like you placed too many requirements into the rewritten text, which also seems to introduce additional restrictions that were not present in the original text. I have clarified the purpose of the rewritten text in the output markdown formatting. Feel free to call me should you need anything changed or the rewrite altered. 
Your satisfaction was key in this exercise, so if needed, we'd be glad
